globalProperty.description: When set to true, the debezium engine will be started otherwise it will not be started

An optional database username for the user account debezium should use to connect to the database to capture the changes if different from that of the OpenMRS user defined in the runtime properties file

An optional password for the user account debezium should use to connect to the database to capture the changes, you only need to set the value of this property if ${project.parent.artifactId}.database.user has been specified

An optional MySQL specific property that takes a comma-separated list of table names whose changes you want to capture, the module does not capture changes in any table not included in this list. By default, the connector captures changes in every table. Do not also set of the ${project.parent.artifactId}.table.exclude.list property because they are mutually exclusive. This property translates to do not capture any tables except these.

An optional MySQL specific property that takes a comma-separated list of table names whose changes you do not want to capture, the module captures changes in any table not included in this list. Do not also set of the value of the ${project.parent.artifactId}.table.include.list property because they are mutually exclusive. This property translates to capture all tables except these.
A required MySQL specific property that specifies the path to a file where the database history is stored
A required path to file where offsets are to be stored

An optional property that specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts, please refer to the official documentation of your respective debezium database connector for possible values, the default connector is for MySQL.

An optional MySQL specific property that controls whether and how long the connector holds the global MySQL read lock, which prevents any updates to the database, while the connector is performing a snapshot, Possible settings are: minimal, minimal_percona, extended, none. The default is extended, for more detailed explanations of these values please refer to the official debezium documentation for the MySQL connector.

An optional MySQL specific property that specifies whether to use an encrypted connection. Possible settings are: disabled, preferred, required, verify_ca, verify_identity. The default is preferred, for more detailed explanations of these values please refer to the official debezium documentation for the MySQL connector.
